attributes.action: confirm the benefits of devolved parliaments
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Given AOL news, that Scottish Government should not be given control of future Scottish elections, the petitioner is calling on the P.M. to 
outline to the electorate what are the benefits of devolution. Will representation rights be the same, on EU, national and international issues ?
Given that 180, 000 ballots how will the new Scottish parliament learn from the experience ? Given the comments of Canadian elections expert, Ron Gould, that "voters were treated as an afterthought", please confirm that MPs are not here solely to win elections, but debate in parliamentary forums.

We the undersigned believe that govt is by the people for the people. Govt is the people.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
